intro: Alsodeia fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered alsike, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. It produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Alsodeia fasciculata is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil.
